channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: New evidence reveals Trump's actions on Jan. 6. And, jury deliberates Tyre Nichols trial
item.description: A judge unsealed new evidence about Trump’s actions on Jan. 6. And, a jury begins deliberations in the brutal police beating case of Tyre Nichols.
item.content:encoded:
A judge unsealed new evidence about Trump’s actions on Jan. 6. And, a jury begins deliberations in the brutal police beating case of Tyre Nichols.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Birders argue over plan to change dozens of bird names
item.description: On Thursday, a major birding society will discuss how how to go about changing potentially offensive bird names. There's resistance to the original plan to rename all birds named after people.
item.content:encoded:
On Thursday, a major birding society will discuss how how to go about changing potentially offensive bird names. There's resistance to the original plan to rename all birds named after people.

(Image credit: egschiller/Getty Images/iStockphoto)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: A downed power line is officially blamed for last year’s Maui wildfire
item.description: The report from the the federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives said that the fire that killed more than 100 people and destroyed the town of Lahaina called the fire “accidental.”
item.content:encoded:
The report from the the federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives said that the fire that killed more than 100 people and destroyed the town of Lahaina called the fire “accidental.”

(Image credit: PATRICK T. FALLON)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: Utah hoping Supreme Court will break precedent and transfer vast tracts of federal land to states
item.description: With the new Supreme Court term set to begin, Utah is hoping the conservative justices will continue to overturn long-established legal precedents, including the federal government's control of U.S. public land.
item.content:encoded:
With the new Supreme Court term set to begin, Utah is hoping the conservative justices will continue to overturn long-established legal precedents, including the federal government's control of U.S. public land.

(Image credit: Photo by Kirk Siegler)
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: Shovel by shovel, N.C. towns dig out from Helene mud and debris
item.description: The small western North Carolina towns of Marshall and Hot Springs were wrecked by historic floods caused by Tropical Storm Helene's rainfall. Days later, residents are just starting the cleanup.
item.content:encoded:
The small western North Carolina towns of Marshall and Hot Springs were wrecked by historic floods caused by Tropical Storm Helene's rainfall. Days later, residents are just starting the cleanup.

(Image credit: Gerard Albert III)
item.dc:creator: Nathan Rott

item.title: It's harder to pay and travel for abortion care, but support funds are struggling
item.description: Financial aid funds that help women pay for abortions — or travel to other states to access care — are struggling financially, despite abortion's role in this year's elections.
item.content:encoded: Financial aid funds that help women pay for abortions — or travel to other states to access care — are struggling financially, despite abortion's role in this year's elections.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Colombini

item.title: Kamala Harris is making an unusual pilgrimage today -- to the birthplace of the GOP
item.description: Harris will travel Thursday to Ripon, Wisconsin — home to the Little White Schoolhouse, where an 1854 meeting led to the birth of the Republican Party. She'll be joined by former GOP Rep. Liz Cheney.
item.content:encoded:
Harris will travel Thursday to Ripon, Wisconsin — home to the Little White Schoolhouse, where an 1854 meeting led to the birth of the Republican Party. She'll be joined by former GOP Rep. Liz Cheney.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Too much presidential politics? State legislatures are also on the ballot
item.description: With so much focus on the presidential election, keep in mind these down-ballot races can lead to big changes in your state when it comes to policies like abortion, health care and criminal justice.
item.content:encoded:
With so much focus on the presidential election, keep in mind these down-ballot races can lead to big changes in your state when it comes to policies like abortion, health care and criminal justice.

(Image credit: Rebecca Noble)
item.dc:creator: Ryland Barton

item.title: How Democrats are targeting red seats in blue New York to help win back the House
item.description: New York Democrats launched a coordinated campaign modeled on more traditional battleground state efforts. Federal, state and local leaders are combining efforts to target a group of House GOP freshmen.
item.content:encoded:
New York Democrats launched a coordinated campaign modeled on more traditional battleground state efforts. Federal, state and local leaders are combining efforts to target a group of House GOP freshmen.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images; Alex Wong/Getty Images; Kent Nishimura/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Deirdre Walsh

item.title: Former Singapore minister sentenced to a year in prison in rare corruption case
item.description: Subramaniam Iswaran is the first Singaporean minister to be jailed in almost fifty years. A case that has shocked a country famed for its squeaky-clean reputation.
item.content:encoded:
Subramaniam Iswaran is the first Singaporean minister to be jailed in almost fifty years. A case that has shocked a country famed for its squeaky-clean reputation.

(Image credit: ROSLAN RAHMANROSLAN RAHMAN)
item.dc:creator: Adam Hancock
